'''DAT''', or '''DANT''', is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "fall down".<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 354 (roots appearing as "DAT-, DANT-")</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Noldorin|Exilic Noldorin]]: ''dad'' ("down"); ''dath'' ("hole, pit")<ref name=LR/>
*[[Quenya]]: ''latta'' ("hole, pit"); ''lanta'' ("a fall"); ''lanta-'' ("to fall")<ref name=LR/>
*[[Noldorin]]: ''dant-'' ("to fall"); ''dannen'' ("fallen")<ref name=LR/>

==Other versions==

The ink version of the entry differs slightly from the published version in the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]''. DAT was given the signification "fall, down".<ref>{{VT|45a}}, p. 8 (root appearing as "DAT-")</ref>
